Problem:
Assume that we have a system modeled by the equation \\( z(t + 1) = Mz(t) \\), where M is a linear operator represented by a matrix. We consider the modification caused by a transformation \\( h(z) = N^t z \\), where N is also a matrix representation of a linear operator.

If at some time \\( t_1 < T \\), a new function \\( i(z) = P^t z \\) (where P is another matrix) is applied as an intervention, will the system state at \\( z(T) \\) depend only on M and not on N or P?
Explanation: The intervention with \\( i(z) \\) introduces additional dynamics to the system, thereby making the endpoint \\( z(T) \\) dependent on M as well as the transformations N and P. The effects are cumulative and dependent on the interaction between these matrices.
